channel.title: GCP on Blowfish
channel.description: Recent content in GCP on Blowfish

item.title: Notes on Using GCP Logging
item.description: Use the SEARCH() function with care # In the GCP Log Explorer, if you type some thing in the search bar without quote, the SEARCH() method is used. The SEARCH() function is case insensitive. Note also that SEARCH() function uses text analyzer to tokenize the string. The SEARCH() function performs exact matches, not partial matching. So SEARCH("world") will not be able to match worldwide. Another example, suppose in some of the log entries, you may have “today is 202408180429”, if you use SEARCH("20240818"), you will find nothing matching, which you may not expect.

item.title: Google Cloud Storage Usage
item.description: Some notes on using the Google Cloud storage.

item.title: How to Download Files from Google Cloud Storage in the Databricks Workspace Notebook
item.description: In this post, I want to share the complete process and setup to download files from GCP in a Databricks workspace notebook. Since the notebook itself is non-interactive when you run the shell command, the setup process is a bit different from the normal GCP authentication.
